content:
I want to very briefly reference the liquid tensor experiment in a paper (to make some remark about Gordan's lemma being needed for it).

What's the preferred way to do so at the moment? Link to the github repository? The most recent mathlib blog post? The quanta or nature article?

Since hopefully the project will be cited many times, it might be worth codifying an answer to Eric's question in a CITATION file: https://docs.github.com/en/repositories/managing-your-repositorys-settings-and-features/customizing-your-repository/about-citation-files
My experience with citation files is that it's easier to just create a CITATION.md with a summary rather than use their recommended file format
Since then you can customize the bibtex to what you actually want people to use
